page.title: 09THE CRICKET DOWN
page.content: The Cricket Down is owned by the Parish Council. It is used by the cricketers and the footballers. The children of the village come down and play on it as well. A teacher who lives in the area holds games evenings in the spring and the summer so the children from the village come and play rounders. The teacher is called Mrs Hancook. The cricketers only play in the summer, during the weekends and evenings. During the winter months the down is used for football. Owslebury village has it's own football and cricket teams. They are an important part of village life. There is a pavillion for the use of the players.
